Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On admission , laboratory examination showed Plasmodium falciparum ( + + + + ) , total bilirubin 8 . 25 mg / dL , conjugated bilirubin 4 . 36 mg / dL , unconjugated bilirubin 3 . 89 mg / dL , potassium 3 . 52 meq / L Patient was diagnosed as severe malaria with jaundice and got quinine infusion in dextrose 5 % 500 mg / 8 hour .

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On admission , laboratory examination showed Plasmodium falciparum ( + + + + ) , total bilirubin 8 . 25 mg / dL , conjugated bilirubin 4 . 36 mg / dL , unconjugated bilirubin 3 . 89 mg / dL , potassium 3 . 52 meq / L Patient was diagnosed as severe malaria with jaundice and got quinine infusion in dextrose 5 % 500 mg / 8 hour .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Plasmodium falciparum |
| total bilirubin (8.25 mg / dL) |
| conjugated bilirubin (4.36 mg / dL) |
| unconjugated bilirubin (3.89 mg / dL) |
| potassium (3.52 meq / L) |
| quinine (500 mg) |
| dextrose (5%) |

Note: The units of measurement are included in the chemical name to ensure precision.

| conjugated bilirubin (4.36 mg/dL) |

| potassium (3.52 meq/L) |

Note: The units of measurement are included in the chemical name to ensure precision. The entities "Plasmodium falciparum" and "quinine" are chemical entities as they are microorganisms and a drug, respectively. The other entities are clinical values that do not refer to specific chemicals.
